title: Interesting script
content:
This script has interesting details and I was hoping someone might recognize it. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055710im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ordering_5784.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055710im_/http:/typophile.com/files/customstationery_3720.png)

Font: 

 Conspired Lovers 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055710/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: incrediblesheep

comments.content:
Nicely done, Ryuk (and nice font).

May I reveal my inadequacy and ask how you found that? I tried 'script' plus' spiderlike' and then 'script' plus 'thin' as searches and had no luck (I've added these as MyFonts tags for the font).

Thanks a lot Mike. I simply recognize it at first sight, thought its name was something like "conspiracy lover" and designed by Mans Greback... Was half-wrong :D Then I used MyFonts which automatically corrected the name and gave me the right answer... Conspired Lovers by Herald Geisler and not Conspiracy Love by Mans Greback!
I wish I had half that memory ... :\>}
I wish I had half of your knowledge and expertise, Mike. Could we make a deal?
